element.label: STATUS
element.definition: Status of order. Enter one of following codes: A for active, H for hold, R for renewed, D for discontinued, E for expired, P for purge, O for on  call, N for nonverified.

element.label: PATIENT
element.definition: This is the name of a patient that has some type of pharmacy order.

element.label: ORDERS FILE ENTRY
element.definition: This value matches this IV order to its entry in the Order file.

element.label: START DATE/TIME
element.definition: This is the date and time the order is to begin. This package initially assigns the START DATE/TIME to the closest administration time or next admin. time or NOW depends on the value of the DEFAULT START DATE CALCULATION field in the WARD PARAMETERS file. START DATE/TIME may not  be entered prior to 7 days from the order's LOGIN DATE.

element.label: STOP DATE/TIME
element.definition: This is the date and time the order is to end.

element.label: CHEMOTHERAPY TYPE
element.definition: A chemotherapy IV order may be one of three types: admixture, piggyback, or syringe.  The type of chemotherapy IV must be identified as one of these types, so the system will know what kinds of questions to ask in order to properly complete this order.

element.label: INTERMITTENT SYRING
element.definition: A syringe IV order may be continuous or intermittent.  If a syringe type is continuous (not intermittent), the same order entry procedure will be followed as if a hyperal or admixture is being entered.  If a syringe order is to be intermittent, the same order entry method as the piggback type will be followed.

element.label: PROVIDER
element.definition: Person who authorized the prescription.

element.label: INFUSION RATE
element.definition: The rate at which the IV is to be administered.  This value, together with the total volume of the hyperal or the admixture type, is used to determine the time covered by one bag; hence the system can predict the bags needed during a specified time of coverage.  This field is free text for IVPB's.  For LVP's you must enter a number representing the infusion rate.  You may also specify the # of bags per day needed, which will become the default number of LABELS PER DAY.    Example: 125 = 125 ml/hr (IV system will calculate bags needed per day)         125@2 = 125 ml/hr with 2 labels per day     TITRATE@1 = TITRATE with 1 label per day  The format of this field is either a number only or  [FREE TEXT@NUMBER OF LABELS PER DAY].   Note:  If an administration time(s) is defined, the number of labels will reflect the administration time(s) for the IVPB type orders. For example:  One administration time of 12:00 is specified.  The infusion rate is entered as 125@3.  Only 1 label will print.

element.label: SCHEDULE
element.definition: You may enter a standard schedule here or non-standard schedule.  If a standard schedule is entered, the doses will be given at the administration time(s). If a non-standard schedule is entered, and no administration times are entered, the doses will be given at time intervals past the start date/time of the IV order.     TID = (09-17-21) doses will be given at admin. times.     Q5H = (300 minutes) doses will be given every 300 minutes. The format of this field is [SCHEDULEspaceFREETEXTspaceFREETEXT] and 1-70 characters.

element.label: ADMINISTRATION TIMES
element.definition: Enter the times that this order will be given separated by a '-'.  The administration times have to be entered in ascending order.  Each  administration time must be at least two characters long or four characters long.  Example: '03-07-11-15-19-23' or '0730-1130'.   Administration times are REQUIRED for STANDARD schedules but are NOT  REQUIRED for NON-STANDARD schedules.

element.label: SCHEDULE INTERVAL
element.definition: Interval between administrations of IV

element.label: CUMULATIVE DOSES
element.definition: Cumulative doses of IV for patient.

element.label: DISPLAY STATUS
element.definition: This field captures how a "Discontinued" action occurred and this code is  displayed on the short patient profile if the Stop Date/Time is within the time specified in the Inpatient Ward Parameter file (#59.6) or the Pharmacy System file (#59.7). The "HP" is to display on the profile if the order was placed on hold by provider through CPRS.

element.label: ORDERABLE ITEM
element.definition: This is the Orderable Item associated with the order. If the order is a unit dose order, all dispense drugs entered must be matched to the order's primary drug. If the order is an IV, at lest one of the additives or solutions entered must match the orderable item.

element.label: MED ROUTE
element.definition: This is the route of administration for this order. This is not required for IV Fluid orders.

element.label: PRIORITY
element.definition: This field contains the priority of the order that was received from OERR.

element.label: NATURE OF ORDER
element.definition: This is the method the provider used to communicate the order to the user to enter (or take any other action on) the order.

element.label: INSTRUCTIONS
element.definition: <blank>

element.label: HOLD FLAG
element.definition: This is a flag set to 1 whenever the order is placed on HOLD or 0 whenever the order is removed from hold.

element.label: ORDERS FILE PARENT ORDER
element.definition: This is the parent of an order that may have a parent/child relationship  in CPRS.

element.label: REMARKS
element.definition: This field is not shown on the IV labels, but is shown on some of the IV reports.

element.label: LOGIN DATE/TIME
element.definition: This is the date and time the order was entered.

element.label: IV ROOM
element.definition: IV room where IV was prepared for administration.

element.label: REASON ORDER CREATED
element.definition: This is used to show the method used to create this order. what actions may be taken on the order.

element.label: ENTRY BY
element.definition: This field contains the pointer value for the person entered the IV order.

element.label: REQUESTED DURATION
element.definition: The duration of an order as requested by the ordering clinician in CPRS. The duration is stored as one of the following upper case letters followed by an integer:     L - Months  W - Weeks  D - Days  H - Hours  M - Minutes  S - Seconds   Example: D6 = Six days.

element.label: REQUESTED IV LIMITATION
element.definition: This is the length of time to administer, or the total volume  to administer, for IV fluid orders. The value may be in ML or CC for milliliters, L for liters, D for days, or H for hours.

element.label: SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS (LONG)
element.definition:
This field contains any special instructions or messages appropriate for this IV order. This field may only be edited when entering an order through the OE/RR package, and will only be displayed when viewing
the order until the order has been verified.

element.label: PV FLAG
element.definition: This is an internal flag set whenever a pharmacist verifies the order.

element.label: NV FLAG
element.definition: This is an internal flag set whenever a nurse verifies the order.

element.label: LABELS PER DAY
element.definition: The number of IV labels needed each day. If populated, this value will  override the system-calculated number of labels.

element.label: LAST FILL
element.definition: Last time the prescription was filled.

element.label: LAST QTY FILLED
element.definition: Quantity of last filled prescription.

element.label: BOTTLE
element.definition: This is the bottle number (or numbers, separated by commas) in which  this additive will be included for this IV order. If this field is blank,  it means that the additive will be included in all bottles.

element.label: STATUS
element.definition: Status of order. Enter one of following codes: A for active, H for hold, R for renewed, D for discontinued, E for expired, P for purge, O for on  call, N for nonverified.

element.label: PRIORITY
element.definition: This field contains the priority of the order that was received from OERR.
